definitions.definition: The act of striking the palms of the hands, or any two surfaces, together.
definitions.example: He summoned the waiter with a clap.

definitions.definition: Any loud, sudden, explosive sound made by striking hard surfaces together, or resembling such a sound.
definitions.example: Off in the distance, he heard the clap of thunder.

definitions.definition: A slap with the hand, usually in a jovial manner.
definitions.example: His father's affection never went further than a handshake or a clap on the shoulder.

definitions.definition: A single, sudden act or motion; a stroke; a blow.
The nether part of the beak of a hawk.
A dropping of cow dung (presumably from the sound made as it hits the ground)
To strike the palms of the hands together, creating a sharp sound.
definitions.example: The children began to clap in time with the music.
It isn’t the singers they are clapping; it's the composer.

definitions.definition: To slap with the hand in a jovial manner.
definitions.example: He would often clap his teammates on the back for encouragement.

definitions.definition: To bring two surfaces together forcefully, creating a sharp sound.
definitions.example: He clapped across the floor in his boots.

definitions.definition: To come together suddenly with noise.
To create or assemble (something) hastily (usually followed by up or together).
definitions.example: The rival factions clapped up a truce.

definitions.definition: To set or put, usually in haste.
definitions.example: She was the prettiest thing I'd ever clapped eyes on.
